summary: This is an email from a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center to the Warden, forwarding a draft document (a follow-up letter to Judge Berman) for review and potential editing. It was sent the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The recipient of a follow-up letter being drafted by the correctional center staff. He was the judge presiding over Jeffrey Epstein's case at the time of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: The recipient of this email, being asked to review and advise on edits to a draft letter addressed to Judge Berman.

persons.name: Supervisory Staff Attorney CLC
persons.context: The sender of this email, who works at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center and is drafting a follow-up letter to Judge Berman for the Warden's review.

connections.description: The Supervisory Staff Attorney is reporting to and seeking approval from the Warden regarding official correspondence.
The Warden's office is preparing official correspondence to Judge Berman, indicating a formal institutional relationship.

events.title: Draft Follow-up to Judge Berman
events.description: A Supervisory Staff Attorney at the MCC New York emails the Warden a draft follow-up letter to Judge Berman for review and potential editing.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: This internal email was sent on August 12, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the MCC.
It shows prison officials were preparing a formal follow-up communication to Judge Berman, who was presiding over Epstein's case.
The email indicates coordination between the prison's legal staff (Supervisory Staff Attorney) and its administration (Warden) following a major incident.
